Figure 1.Dataset construction process for applications inOpbench.
(a)Opioid Overdose Detection: We leverage the PDMP dataset from the State of Ohio to construct a heterogeneous graph with four node types to detect patients at risk of opioid overdose.
(b)Illicit Online Drug Trafficking: We collect metadata from X/Twitter and construct a hypergraph and a multi-relation graph to capture group-wise interactions and diverse relation types among users for community detection and role classification tasks.
(c)Opioid Misuse Detection: We employ the NHANES data to construct a heterogeneous graph over five node types to predict opioid misuse through dietary patterns.

Figure 2.Inference time (ms) across hidden dimensions (64, 128, 256, 512). Left and middle panels show hypergraph neural networks onX-HyDrug-CommandX-HyDrug-Role; right panel shows heterogeneous graph neural networks onNHANES-Diet.
